sections.name: hook_polished

sentences.text: This video was 100% edited by Codecs and 0% by me.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: Let me show you what I mean.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sections.notes: Polished hook; no raw shot. Title + hero framing.

sentences.text: So this was the actual recording.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: This is me in my pajamas in my living room with the standard webcam from MacBook Pro.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: That's it.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: So now agents like Codecs are really popular for writing code, but I wanted to see if I give them an access to a bunch of multimedia tools.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: Can they do something really interesting with video and audio?
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sections.name: active_speaker_demo

sentences.text: So first I'm going to ask Codec to run active speaker detection to figure out where I am in the frame.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: And then now to draw a box around what it found.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: And hopefully when I move, the box still moves with me.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: And now I'm going to ask to put the box somewhere in the bottom right corner.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sections.notes: Coordinates -> endpoints -> draw box -> move box bottom-right.

sections.name: canvas_and_tools

sentences.text: So once it does that, I'm going to ask it to bring up a canvas across the screen.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: And now I'm going to ask it to show a bunch of cool animation in this canvas that it just brought up.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: So I'm going to explain how it all work.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: So Codex had an access to three tools here.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: One, which is a simple transcription engine, which gave a word level timestamps.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: Two, it had a small active speaker detection model, using which it can find where the faces are in the frame.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: Third, I just gave it action to a re-motion skill, which is what inspired this entire video, and asked it to create an animation for what I'm talking about now.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: Yeah, obviously what you see right now is not real-time rendered.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: I'm going to record this and go back to Codex and hopefully prompt it and get some magical effects that you could see.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: But if it does work, then it's pretty cool.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: The latency is an issue, but I think that will also soon go away.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sentences.text: How we went from, I don't know, DVD to streaming or also video games, You'll be able to manipulate your pixels live with tools like these agents like Codex, and the future is going to be exciting.
sentences.speaker: speaker_1

sections.notes: Canvas enters, tool callouts, disclaimer, future vision/outro.

crop_timeline.strategy: use original video + animated crop in Remotion
